title: Rewrites Abortion Positions - Denies Own Statements Weekly
summary: Trump has taken multiple contradictory positions on abortion and denies previous statements regularly. Claimed credit for overturning Roe v. Wade, then denied supporting bans. Said women should be 'punished' for abortion (2016), denied saying it hours later. Called himself 'strongly pro-life,' then claimed he's 'not going to do a federal ban.' Praised state bans, then criticized them. Takes every position then denies taking any position.
keyFacts: 2016: Said women should face 'some form of punishment' for having abortions, walked it back same day
2016-2020: Campaigned as 'strongly pro-life' and promised to appoint justices to overturn Roe
2022: Took credit for Roe being overturned: 'I was able to kill Roe v. Wade'
2023: Praised Florida's 6-week abortion ban as 'a great thing'
2024: Called Florida's 6-week ban 'too harsh' and claimed he never supported it
2024: Said abortion should be 'left to the states' then criticized states with strict bans
September 2024: Claimed he would veto a federal abortion ban, then said he wouldn't
Takes credit for overturning Roe in speeches to anti-abortion groups, denies it hurt Republicans in general election
His VP pick JD Vance supports federal abortion restrictions; Trump denies this is his position
Pattern: Says one thing to one audience, opposite to another, then denies both
